articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Stanislav Khrustalev)
articles.description: While QR codes have many uses and can be leveraged at many touch points, they are just one of dozens of technologies that can improve the customerâ€™s journey. Stanislav Khrustalev shares his advice with a list of things to keep in mind when using QR codes for your business.

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Noam Rosenthal)
articles.description: In this second part, Noam suggests a few patterns of how to use the web platform directly as an alternative to some of the solutions that are offered by frameworks.
articles.title: What Web Frameworks Solve: The Vanilla Alternative (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Michelle Barker)
articles.description: In this article, weâ€™ll look specifically at what we can do to reduce the impact of social media embeds and social sharing widgets â€” or even some strategies to avoid them altogether. While the spotlight is on reducing the environmental impact, many of these tips will be great for performance too.
articles.title: Reducing The Webâ€™s Carbon Footprint: Optimizing Social Media Embeds

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: In this article, Adrian Bece shares more about the benefits and caveats of code-splitting and how page performance and load times can be improved by dynamically loading expensive, non-critical JavaScript bundles.
articles.title: Improving JavaScript Bundle Performance With Code-Splitting

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Itâ€™s shipping! Meet â€œTouch Design for Mobile Interfacesâ€, our brand-new guide with guidelines and best practices to improve usability and accessibility on mobile. 400 pages. For designers and developers working with mobile UIs.
articles.title: Meet â€œTouch Design For Mobile Interfacesâ€, A New Smashing Book

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Noam Rosenthal)
articles.description: In this article, Noam Rosenthal dives deep into a few technical features that are common across frameworks, and explains how some of the different frameworks implement them and what they cost.
articles.title: What Web Frameworks Solve And How To Do Without Them (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Shell Zhu & Adrian Jones)
articles.description: This article reveals how something as trivial as administration in both software and As-a-service can be either a booster or bottleneck to a companyâ€™s productivity and innovation. It also provides several design aspects that UX practitioners should evaluate when designing the administration experience.

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Patrick Brosset)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Javier Cuello)
articles.description: Joining a team where there are no established design practices may feel disheartening. Does this situation resonate with you? articles.description: Every once in a while, we publish [freebies](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/category/freebies) related to different occasions and themes.
